info.title: PI Web API 2018 Swagger Spec
info.description: Swagger Spec file that describes PI Web API

get.summary: Get top level links for this PI System Web API instance.

200.description: Links to top level collections and system information.

get.summary: Retrieve an Analysis by path.
get.description: This method returns an Analysis based on the hierarchical path associated with it, and should be used when a path has been received from a separate part of the PI System for use in the PI Web API. Users should primarily search with the WebID when available.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the Analysis.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

get.summary: Retrieve an Analysis.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the Analysis.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

patch.summary: Update an Analysis.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the Analysis to update.

parameters.name: analysis
parameters.description: A partial Analysis containing the desired changes.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the Analysis to delete.

get.summary: Get an Analysis' categories.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the Analysis.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

get.summary: Get the security information of the specified security item associated with the Analysis for a specified user.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the Analysis for the security to be checked.

parameters.name: userIdentity
parameters.description: The user identity for the security information to be checked. Multiple security identities may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter. If the parameter is not specified, only the current user's security rights will be returned.

parameters.name: forceRefresh
parameters.description: Indicates if the security cache should be refreshed before getting security information. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

400.description: An invalid or local account is specified as the user identity.

401.description: Access denied for the specified user identity.

409.description: Unsupported when using Anonymous authentication method.

502.description: Failed to retrieve the specified user identity.

get.summary: Retrieve the security entries associated with the analysis based on the specified criteria. By default, all security entries for this analysis are returned.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the analysis.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string used for filtering security entries. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: A list of security entries matching the specified condition.

post.summary: Create a security entry owned by the analysis.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the analysis, where the security entry will be created.

parameters.name: securityEntry
parameters.description: The new security entry definition. The full list of allow and deny rights must be supplied.

parameters.name: applyToChildren
parameters.description: If false, the new access permissions are only applied to the associated object. If true, the access permissions of children with any parent-child reference types will change when the permissions on the primary parent change.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

201.description: The security entry was created. The response's Location header is a link to the security entry.

get.summary: Retrieve the security entry associated with the analysis with the specified name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the security entry. For every backslash character (\) in the security entry name, replace with asterisk (*). As an example, use domain*username instead of domain\username.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the analysis.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: The security entry matching the specified condition.

404.description: The security entry with the specified name is not found.

put.summary: Update a security entry owned by the analysis.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the security entry.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the analysis, where the security entry will be updated.

parameters.name: securityEntry
parameters.description: The new security entry definition. The full list of allow and deny rights must be supplied or they will be removed.

parameters.name: applyToChildren
parameters.description: If false, the new access permissions are only applied to the associated object. If true, the access permissions of children with any parent-child reference types will change when the permissions on the primary parent change.

delete.summary: Delete a security entry owned by the analysis.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the security entry. For every backslash character (\) in the security entry name, replace with asterisk (*). As an example, use domain*username instead of domain\username.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the analysis, where the security entry will be deleted.

parameters.name: applyToChildren
parameters.description: If false, the new access permissions are only applied to the associated object. If true, the access permissions of children with any parent-child reference types will change when the permissions on the primary parent change.

get.summary: Retrieve analyses based on the specified conditions. By default, returns all analyses.

parameters.name: databaseWebId
parameters.description: The ID of the asset database to use as the root of the query.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be returned per call (page size). The default is 1000.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query string is a list of filters used to perform an AFSearch for the analyses in the asset database. An example would be: "query= Name:=MyAnalysis1* Template:=AnalysisTemplate*".

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: A list of analyses matching the specified conditions.

get.summary: Get the child Analysis Rules of the Analysis Rule.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent Analysis Rule.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be returned per call (page size). The default is 1000.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string used for finding Analysis Rules. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: searchFullHierarchy
parameters.description: Specifies if the search should include Analysis Rules nested further than the immediate children of the searchRoot. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: The field or property of the object used to sort the returned collection. The default is 'Name'.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order that the returned collection is sorted. The default is 'Ascending'.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: A list of child Analysis Rules.

post.summary: Create a new Analysis Rule as a child of an existing Analysis Rule.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent Analysis Rule, on which to create the child Analysis Rule.

parameters.name: analysisRule
parameters.description: The definition of the new Analysis Rule.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

201.description: The Analysis Rule was created. The response's Location header is a link to the created Analysis Rule.

get.summary: Retrieve an analysis template by path.
get.description: This method returns an analysis template based on the hierarchical path associated with it, and should be used when a path has been received from a separate part of the PI System for use in the PI Web API. Users should primarily search with the WebID when available.

parameters.name: path

post.summary: Create an Analysis template based upon a specified Analysis.

parameters.name: analysisWebId
parameters.description: The ID of the Analysis, on which the template is created.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name for the created template, which must be unique within the database's AnalysisTemplate collection. If the name ends with an asterisk (*), then a unique name will be generated based on the supplied name. The default is the specified Analysis' name suffixed with an asterisk (*).

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

201.description: The Analysis Template was created. The response's Location header is a link to the created Analysis Template.

get.summary: Retrieve analyses based on the specified conditions.
get.description: Users can search for the analyses based on specific search parameters. If no parameters are specified in the search, the default values for each parameter will be used and will return the analyses that match the default search.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the database to search for the analyses.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Specifies which of the object's properties are searched. Multiple search fields may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter. The default is 'Name'.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be returned per call (page size). The default is 1000.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query string used for finding analyses. The default is null.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: The field or property of the object used to sort the returned collection. The default is 'Name'.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order that the returned collection is sorted. The default is 'Ascending'.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: A list of analyses matching the specified conditions.

parameters.name: webIdType

200.description: The analysis categories that exist in the database.

parameters.name: webId

get.summary: Retrieves a list of event frame attributes matching the specified filters from the specified asset database.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the asset database to use as the root of the search.

parameters.name: attributeCategory
parameters.description: Specify that returned attributes must have this category. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: attributeDescriptionFilter
parameters.description: The attribute description filter string used for finding objects. Only the first 440 characters of the description will be searched. For Asset Servers older than 2.7, a 400 status code (Bad Request) will be returned if this parameter is specified. The default is no filter.

parameters.description: A string representing the latest ending time for the event frames to be matched. The endTime must be greater than or equal to the startTime. The default is '*'.

parameters.name: eventFrameCategory
parameters.description: Specify that the owner of the returned attributes must have this category. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: eventFrameDescriptionFilter
parameters.description: The event frame description filter string used for finding objects. Only the first 440 characters of the description will be searched. For Asset Servers older than 2.7, a 400 status code (Bad Request) will be returned if this parameter is specified. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: eventFrameNameFilter
parameters.description: The event frame name filter string used for finding objects. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: eventFrameTemplate
parameters.description: Specify that the owner of the returned attributes must have this template or a template derived from this template. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be returned (the page size). The default is 1000.

parameters.name: referencedElementNameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string which must match the name of a referenced element. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: searchFullHierarchy
parameters.description: Specifies if the search should include objects nested further than immediate children of the given resource. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: searchMode
parameters.description: Determines how the startTime and endTime parameters are treated when searching for event frames. The default is 'Overlapped'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: The field or property of the object used to sort the returned collection. The default is 'Name'.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order that the returned collection is sorted. The default is 'Ascending'.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: A string representing the earliest starting time for the event frames to be matched. startTime must be less than or equal to the endTime. The default is '*-8h'.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

get.summary: Retrieve event frames based on the specified conditions. By default, returns all children of the specified root resource that have been active in the past 8 hours.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the asset database to use as the root of the search.

parameters.name: canBeAcknowledged
parameters.description: Specify the returned event frames' canBeAcknowledged property. The default is no canBeAcknowledged filter.

parameters.name: categoryName
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this category. The default is no category filter.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: The ending time for the search. The endTime must be greater than or equal to the startTime. The searchMode parameter will control whether the comparison will be performed against the event frame's startTime or endTime. The default is '*' if searchMode is not one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values.

parameters.name: isAcknowledged
parameters.description: Specify the returned event frames' isAcknowledged property. The default no isAcknowledged filter.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be returned per call (page size). The default is 1000.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string used for finding event frames. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: referencedElementNameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string which must match the name of a referenced element. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: referencedElementTemplateName
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have an element in the event frame's referenced elements collection that derives from the template. Specify this parameter by name.

parameters.name: searchFullHierarchy
parameters.description: Specifies whether the search should include objects nested further than the immediate children of the search root. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: searchMode
parameters.description: Determines how the startTime and endTime parameters are treated when searching for event frame objects to be included in the returned collection. If this parameter is one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values, none of endTime, sortField, or sortOrder may be specified. The default is 'Overlapped'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this severity. Multiple severity values may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter. The default is no severity filter.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: The field or property of the object used to sort the returned collection. The default is 'Name' if searchMode is not one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order that the returned collection is sorted. The default is 'Ascending' if searchMode is not one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The starting time for the search. startTime must be less than or equal to the endTime. The searchMode parameter will control whether the comparison will be performed against the event frame's startTime or endTime. The default is '*-8h'.

parameters.name: templateName
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this template or a template derived from this template. The default is no template filter. Specify this parameter by name.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: A list of event frames matching the specified conditions.

post.summary: Create an event frame.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the database on which to create the event frame.

parameters.name: eventFrame
parameters.description: The new event frame definition.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

201.description: The event frame was created. The response's Location header is a link to the event frame.

get.summary: Get the security information of the specified security item associated with the asset database for a specified user.

parameters.description: The ID of the asset database for the security to be checked.

parameters.name: securityItem
parameters.description: The security item of the desired security information to be returned. Multiple security items may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter. If the parameter is not specified, only 'Default' security item of the security information will be returned.

parameters.name: userIdentity
parameters.description: The user identity for the security information to be checked. Multiple security identities may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter. If the parameter is not specified, only the current user's security rights will be returned.

parameters.name: forceRefresh
parameters.description: Indicates if the security cache should be refreshed before getting security information. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

400.description: Unsupported security item; an invalid or local account is specified as the user identity.

401.description: Access denied for the specified user identity.

409.description: Unsupported when using Anonymous authentication method.

502.description: Failed to retrieve the specified user identity.

post.summary: Execute a batch of requests against the service. As shown in the Sample Request, the input is a dictionary with IDs as keys and request objects as values. Each request object specifies the HTTP method and the resource and, optionally, the content and a list of parent IDs. The list of parent IDs specifies which other requests must complete before the given request will be executed. The example first creates an element, then gets the element by the response's Location header, then creates an attribute for the element. Note that the resource can be an absolute URL or a JsonPath that references the response to the parent request. The batch's response is a dictionary uses keys corresponding those provided in the request, with response objects containing a status code, response headers, and the response body. A request can alternatively specify a request template in place of a resource. In this case, a single JsonPath may select multiple tokens, and a separate subrequest will be made from the template for each token. The responses of these subrequests will returned as the content of a single outer response.

parameters.name: batch
parameters.description: The batch of requests.

207.description: A dictionary of response information corresponding to the batched requests.

get.summary: Returns results of evaluating the expression over the time range from the start time to the end time at a defined interval.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: An optional end time. The default is '*' for element attributes and points. For event frame attributes, the default is the event frame's end time, or '*' if that is not set. Note that if endTime is earlier than startTime, the resulting values will be in time-descending order.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: A string containing the expression to be evaluated. The syntax for the expression generally follows the Performance Equation syntax as described in the PI Server documentation, with the exception that expressions which target AF objects use attribute names in place of tag names in the equation.

parameters.name: sampleInterval
parameters.description: A time span specifies how often the filter expression is evaluated when computing the summary for an interval.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: An optional start time. The default is '*-1d' for element attributes and points. For event frame attributes, the default is the event frame's start time, or '*-1d' if that is not set.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the target object of the expression. A target object can be a Data Server, a database, an element, an event frame or an attribute. References to attributes or points are based on the target. If this parameter is not provided, the target object is set to null.

409.description: The targeted object does not support the calculation.

parameters.name: expression

parameters.name: webId

get.summary: Returns the result of evaluating the expression over the time range from the start time to the end time. The time range is first divided into a number of summary intervals. Then the calculation is performed for the specified summaries over each interval.

parameters.name: calculationBasis
parameters.description: Specifies the method of evaluating the data over the time range. The default is 'TimeWeighted'.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: An optional end time. The default is '*' for element attributes and points. For event frame attributes, the default is the event frame's end time, or '*' if that is not set. Note that if endTime is earlier than startTime, the resulting values will be in time-descending order.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: A string containing the expression to be evaluated. The syntax for the expression generally follows the Performance Equation syntax as described in the PI Server documentation, with the exception that expressions which target AF objects use attribute names in place of tag names in the equation.

parameters.name: sampleInterval
parameters.description: A time span specifies how often the filter expression is evaluated when computing the summary for an interval, if the sampleType is 'Interval'.

parameters.name: sampleType
parameters.description: A flag which specifies one or more summaries to compute for each interval over the time range. The default is 'ExpressionRecordedValues'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: An optional start time. The default is '*-1d' for element attributes and points. For event frame attributes, the default is the event frame's start time, or '*-1d' if that is not set.

parameters.name: summaryDuration
parameters.description: The duration of each summary interval.

parameters.name: summaryType
parameters.description: Specifies the kinds of summaries to produce over the range. The default is 'Total'. Multiple summary types may be specified by using multiple instances of summaryType.

parameters.name: timeType
parameters.description: Specifies how to calculate the timestamp for each interval. The default is 'Auto'.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the target object of the expression. A target object can be a Data Server, a database, an element, an event frame or an attribute. References to attributes or points are based on the target. If this parameter is not provided, the target object is set to null.

409.description: The targeted object does not support the calculation.

parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this category. The default is no category filter.

parameters.description: The ending time for the search. The endTime must be greater than or equal to the startTime. parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this severity. Multiple severity values may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter. The default is no severity filter.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: The field or property of the object used to sort the returned collection. The default is 'Name' if searchMode is not one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order that the returned collection is sorted. The default is 'Ascending' if searchMode is not one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The starting time for the search. startTime must be less than or equal to the endTime. The searchMode parameter will control whether the comparison will be performed against the event frame's startTime or endTime. The default is '*-8h'.

parameters.name: templateName
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this template or a template derived from this template. The default is no template filter. Specify this parameter by name.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

parameters.description: Specify that returned attributes' value type must be the given value type. The default is no value type filter.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of event frame attributes matching the specified filters from the specified event frame.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the event frame to use as the root of the search.

parameters.name: attributeCategory
parameters.description: Specify that returned attributes must have this category. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: attributeDescriptionFilter
parameters.description: The attribute description filter string used for finding objects. Only the first 440 characters of the description will be searched. For Asset Servers older than 2.7, a 400 status code (Bad Request) will be returned if this parameter is specified. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: attributeNameFilter
parameters.description: The attribute name filter string used for finding objects. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: attributeType
parameters.description: Specify that returned attributes' value type must be this value type. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: A string representing the latest ending time for the event frames to be matched. The endTime must be greater than or equal to the startTime. The default is '*'.

parameters.name: eventFrameCategory
parameters.description: Specify that the owner of the returned attributes must have this category. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: eventFrameDescriptionFilter
parameters.description: The event frame description filter string used for finding objects. Only the first 440 characters of the description will be searched. For Asset Servers older than 2.7, a 400 status code (Bad Request) will be returned if this parameter is specified. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: eventFrameNameFilter
parameters.description: The event frame name filter string used for finding objects. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: eventFrameTemplate
parameters.description: Specify that the owner of the returned attributes must have this template or a template derived from this template. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be returned (the page size). The default is 1000.

parameters.name: referencedElementNameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string which must match the name of a referenced element. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: searchFullHierarchy
parameters.description: Specifies if the search should include objects nested further than immediate children of the given resource. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: searchMode
parameters.description: Determines how the startTime and endTime parameters are treated when searching for event frames. The default is 'Overlapped'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: The field or property of the object used to sort the returned collection. The default is 'Name'.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order that the returned collection is sorted. The default is 'Ascending'.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: A string representing the earliest starting time for the event frames to be matched. startTime must be less than or equal to the endTime. The default is '*-8h'.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

get.summary: Retrieve event frames based on the specified conditions. By default, returns all children of the specified root event frame that have been active in the past 8 hours.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the event frame to use as the root of the search.

parameters.name: canBeAcknowledged
parameters.description: Specify the returned event frames' canBeAcknowledged property. The default is no canBeAcknowledged filter.

parameters.name: categoryName
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this category. The default is no category filter.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: The ending time for the search. The endTime must be greater than or equal to the startTime. The searchMode parameter will control whether the comparison will be performed against the event frame's startTime or endTime. The default is '*' if searchMode is not one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values.

parameters.name: isAcknowledged
parameters.description: Specify the returned event frames' isAcknowledged property. The default no isAcknowledged filter.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be returned per call (page size). The default is 1000.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string used for finding event frames. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: referencedElementNameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string which must match the name of a referenced element. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: referencedElementTemplateName
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have an element in the event frame's referenced elements collection that derives from the template. Specify this parameter by name.

parameters.name: searchFullHierarchy
parameters.description: Specifies whether the search should include objects nested further than the immediate children of the search root. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: searchMode
parameters.description: Determines how the startTime and endTime parameters are treated when searching for event frame objects to be included in the returned collection. If this parameter is one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values, none of endTime, sortField, or sortOrder may be specified. The default is 'Overlapped'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this severity. Multiple severity values may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter. The default is no severity filter.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: The field or property of the object used to sort the returned collection. The default is 'Name' if searchMode is not one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order that the returned collection is sorted. The default is 'Ascending' if searchMode is not one of the 'Backward*' or 'Forward*' values.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The starting time for the search. startTime must be less than or equal to the endTime. The searchMode parameter will control whether the comparison will be performed against the event frame's startTime or endTime. The default is '*-8h'.

parameters.name: templateName
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this template or a template derived from this template. The default is no template filter. Specify this parameter by name.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: A list of event frames matching the specified conditions.

parameters.description: The new security entry definition. The full list of allow and deny rights must be supplied.

parameters.name: applyToChildren
parameters.description: If false, the new access permissions are only applied to the associated object. If true, the access permissions of children with any parent-child reference types will change when the permissions on the primary parent change.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

201.description: The security entry was created. The response's Location header is a link to the security entry.

get.summary: Retrieve event frames based on the specified conditions. Returns event frames using the specified search query string.

parameters.name: databaseWebId
parameters.description: The ID of the asset database to use as the root of the query.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be returned per call (page size). The default is 1000.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query string is a list of filters used to perform an AFSearch for the eventframes in the asset database. An example would be: "query=Name:=MyEventFrame* Category:=MyCategory Template:=EFTemplate*".

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: A list of event frames matching the specified conditions.

post.summary: Create a link for a "Search EventFrames By Attribute Value" operation, whose queries are specified in the request content. The SearchRoot is specified by the Web Id of the root EventFrame. If the SearchRoot is not specified, then the search starts at the Asset Database. ElementTemplate must be provided as the Web ID of the ElementTemplate, which are used to create the EventFrames. All the attributes in the queries must be defined as AttributeTemplates on the ElementTemplate. An array of attribute value queries are ANDed together to find the desired Element objects. At least one value query must be specified. There are limitations on SearchOperators.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query of search by attribute.

parameters.name: noResults
parameters.description: If false, the response content will contain the first page of the search results. If true, the response content will be empty. The default is false.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

201.description: The link is stored in the response's "Location" header. The response content is the first page of the search result by the default parameters.

400.description: Empty or invalid request content.

get.summary: Execute a "Search EventFrames By Attribute Value" operation.

parameters.name: searchId
parameters.description: The encoded search Id of the "Search EventFrames By Attribute Value" operation.

parameters.name: canBeAcknowledged
parameters.description: Specify the returned event frames' canBeAcknowledged property. The default is no canBeAcknowledged filter.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: The ending time for the search. endTime must be greater than or equal to the startTime. The searchMode parameter will control whether the comparison will be performed against the event frame's startTime or endTime. The default is '*'.

parameters.name: isAcknowledged
parameters.description: Specify the returned event frames' isAcknowledged property. The default no isAcknowledged filter.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to be returned per call (page size). The default is 1000.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string used for finding event frames. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: referencedElementNameFilter
parameters.description: The name query string which must match the name of a referenced element. The default is no filter.

parameters.name: searchFullHierarchy
parameters.description: Specifies whether the search should include objects nested further than the immediate children of the search root. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: searchMode
parameters.description: Determines how the startTime and endTime parameters are treated when searching for event frame objects to be included in the returned collection. The default is 'Overlapped'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: Specify that returned event frames must have this severity. Multiple severity values may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter. The default is no severity filter.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: The field or property of the object used to sort the returned collection. The default is 'Name'.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order that the returned collection is sorted. The default is 'Ascending'.

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: The starting index (zero based) of the items to be returned. The default is 0.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The starting time for the search. startTime must be less than or equal to the endTime. The searchMode parameter will control whether the comparison will be performed against the event frame's startTime or endTime. The default is '*-8h'.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

400.description: Invalid search Id or search parameters.

parameters.description: HeartbeatRate is an integer multiple of the Polling Interval. It specifies the rate at which a client will receive an empty message if there are no data updates. It can be used to check that the connection is still alive. Zero/negative values correspond to no heartbeat. By default, no empty messages will be sent to the user.

parameters.name: includeInitialValues
parameters.description: Specified if the channel should send a message with the current value of the stream after the connection is opened. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

get.description: Any time series value in the response that contains an 'Errors' property indicates PI Web API encountered a handled error during the transfer of the response stream.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the stream.

parameters.name: desiredUnits
parameters.description: The name or abbreviation of the desired units of measure for the returned value, as found in the UOM database associated with the attribute. If not specified for an attribute, the attribute's default unit of measure is used. If the underlying stream is a point, this value may not be specified, as points are not associated with a unit of measure.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: An optional end time. The default is '*' for element attributes and points. For event frame attributes, the default is the event frame's end time, or '*' if that is not set. Note that if endTime is earlier than startTime, the resulting values will be in time-descending order.

parameters.name: filterExpression
parameters.description: An optional string containing a filter expression. Expression variables are relative to the data point. Use '.' to reference the containing attribute. If the attribute does not support filtering, the filter will be ignored. The default is no filtering.

parameters.name: includeFilteredValues
parameters.description: Specify 'true' to indicate that values which fail the filter criteria are present in the returned data at the times where they occurred with a value set to a 'Filtered' enumeration value with bad status. Repeated consecutive failures are omitted.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The sampling interval, in AFTimeSpan format.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: An optional start time. The default is '*-1d' for element attributes and points. For event frame attributes, the default is the event frame's start time, or '*-1d' if that is not set.

parameters.name: syncTime
parameters.description: An optional start time anchor, in AFTime format. When specified, interpolated data retrieval will use the sync time as the origin for calculating the interval times.

parameters.name: syncTimeBoundaryType
parameters.description: An optional string specifying the boundary type to use when applying a syncTime. The allowed values are 'Inside' and 'Outside'. The default is 'Inside'.

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The time zone in which the time string will be interpreted. This parameter will be ignored if a time zone is specified in the time string. If no time zone is specified in either places, the PI Web API server time zone will be used.

200.description: The values that meet the specified conditions.

400.description: The request was malformed.

409.description: The data reference does not support this method, or the supplied filter expression is unsupported, or the desired units of measure are incompatible.

get.summary: Returns a list of compressed values for the requested time range from the source provider.
get.description: Returned times are affected by the specified boundary type. If no values are found for the time range and conditions specified then the HTTP response will be success, with a body containing an empty array of Items. When specifying true for the includeFilteredValues parameter, consecutive filtered events are not returned. The first value that would be filtered out is returned with its time and the enumeration value "Filtered". The next value in the collection will be the next compressed value in the specified direction that passes the filter criteria - if any. When both boundaryType and a filterExpression are specified, the events returned for the boundary condition specified are passed through the filter. If the includeFilteredValues parameter is true, the boundary values will be reported at the proper timestamps with the enumeration value "Filtered" when the filter conditions are not met at the boundary time. If the includeFilteredValues parameter is false for this case, no event is returned for the boundary time. Any time series value in the response that contains an 'Errors' property indicates PI Web API encountered a handled error during the transfer of the response stream.   If only recorded values with annotations are desired, the filterExpression parameter should include the filter IsSet('.', "a").

get.summary: Returns a summary over the specified time range for the stream.
get.description: Count is the only summary type supported on non-numeric streams. Requesting a summary for any other type will generate an error. Time-weighted totals are computed by integrating the rate tag values over the requested time range. If some of the data are bad in the time range, the calculated total is divided by the fraction of the time period for which there are good values. This approach is equivalent to assuming that during the period of bad data, the tag takes on the average values for the entire calculation time range. The PercentGood summary may be used to determine if the calculation results are suitable for the application's purposes. For time-weighted totals, if the time unit rate of the stream cannot be determined, then the value will be totaled assuming a unit of "per day" and no unit of measure will be assigned to the value. If the measured time component of the tag is not based on a day, the user of the data must convert the totalized value to the correct units.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of the stream.

parameters.name: calculationBasis
parameters.description: Specifies the method of evaluating the data over the time range. The default is 'TimeWeighted'.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: An optional end time. The default is '*' for element attributes and points. For event frame attributes, the default is the event frame's end time, or '*' if that is not set. Note that if endTime is earlier than startTime, the resulting values will be in time-descending order.

parameters.name: filterExpression
parameters.description: A string containing a filter expression. Expression variables are relative to the attribute. Use '.' to reference the containing attribute.

parameters.name: sampleInterval
parameters.description: When the sampleType is Interval, sampleInterval specifies how often the filter expression is evaluated when computing the summary for an interval.

parameters.name: sampleType
parameters.description: Defines the evaluation of an expression over a time range. The default is 'ExpressionRecordedValues'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: summaryDuration
parameters.description: The duration of each summary interval. If specified in hours, minutes, seconds, or milliseconds, the summary durations will be evenly spaced UTC time intervals. Longer interval types are interpreted using wall clock rules and are time zone dependent.

parameters.name: summaryType
parameters.description: Specifies the kinds of summaries to produce over the range. The default is 'Total'. Multiple summary types may be specified by using multiple instances of summaryType.

parameters.name: timeType
parameters.description: Specifies how to calculate the timestamp for each interval. The default is 'Auto'.

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The time zone in which the time string will be interpreted. This parameter will be ignored if a time zone is specified in the time string. If no time zone is specified in either places, the PI Web API server time zone will be used.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of a stream. Multiple streams may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter.

parameters.name: retrievalMode
parameters.description: An optional value that determines the values to return when values don't exist at the exact time specified. The default is 'Auto'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order that the returned collection is sorted. The default is 'Ascending'.

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The time zone in which the time string will be interpreted. This parameter will be ignored if a time zone is specified in the time string. If no time zone is specified in either places, the PI Web API server time zone will be used.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: Recorded values of the streams that meet the specified conditions.

400.description: The request was malformed.

502.description: The request was cancelled.

get.summary: Returns summary values of the specified streams.
get.description: Any time series value in the response that contains an 'Errors' property indicates PI Web API encountered a handled error during the transfer of the response stream.

parameters.name: webId
parameters.description: The ID of a stream. Multiple streams may be specified with multiple instances of the parameter.

parameters.name: calculationBasis
parameters.description: Specifies the method of evaluating the data over the time range. The default is 'TimeWeighted'.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: An optional end time. The default is '*'. Note that if endTime is earlier than startTime, the resulting values will be in time-descending order.

parameters.name: filterExpression
parameters.description: A string containing a filter expression. Expression variables are relative to the attribute. Use '.' to reference the containing attribute. The default is no filtering.

parameters.name: sampleInterval
parameters.description: A time span specifies how often the filter expression is evaluated when computing the summary for an interval, if the sampleType is 'Interval'.

parameters.name: sampleType
parameters.description: A flag which specifies one or more summaries to compute for each interval over the time range. The default is 'ExpressionRecordedValues'.

parameters.name: selectedFields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned in the response, separated by semicolons (;). If this parameter is not specified, all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: An optional start time. The default is '*-1d'.

parameters.name: summaryDuration
parameters.description: The duration of each summary interval.

parameters.name: summaryType
parameters.description: Specifies the kinds of summaries to produce over the range. The default is 'Total'. Multiple summary types may be specified by using multiple instances of summaryType.

parameters.name: timeType
parameters.description: Specifies how to calculate the timestamp for each interval. The default is 'Auto'.

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The time zone in which the time string will be interpreted. This parameter will be ignored if a time zone is specified in the time string. If no time zone is specified in either places, the PI Web API server time zone will be used.

parameters.name: webIdType
parameters.description: Optional parameter. Used to specify the type of WebID. Useful for URL brevity and other special cases. Default is the value of the configuration item "WebIDType".

200.description: Summary values of the streams that meet the specified conditions.

409.description: Unsupported operation on the given AF object.

parameters.description: The desired AFBufferOption. The default is 'BufferIfPossible'.
